Overview.title: What is Financial Literacy?
content: Financial literacy is the ability to use knowledge and skills to manage financial resources effectively.
It empowers individuals to make sound financial decisions throughout their lives.
It is accessible to anyone, regardless of education level.
Overview.summary: Financial literacy enables lifelong financial well-being through informed money management.

Earning Money.title: EARN: Sources of Income
content: Earning involves generating money through employment, business, or investments.
Encourage developing values like honesty, discipline, and goal setting.
Identify ways of earning based on your profession or skillset.
Earning Money.summary: Understanding income sources helps build a strong foundation for financial growth.

Spending Wisely.title: SPEND: Managing Expenses
content: Manage your money by creating a personal budget and not living beyond your means.
Differentiate between needs and wants (necessities vs. luxuries).
Budgeting gives you control over your money and enables goal setting.
Spending Wisely.summary: Effective spending requires discipline and understanding your financial habits.

Budgeting Basics.title: SPEND: Budgeting Strategies
content: Track your expenses monthly and categorize fixed vs. variable costs.
Add savings into your budget — 'Pay yourself first.'
A good budget plan helps reduce debt and aligns with short- and long-term goals.
Budgeting Basics.summary: A successful budget plan is realistic, honest, and adaptable.

Saving & Investing.title: SAVE & INVEST: Building Wealth
content: Start saving with small, consistent contributions — e.g., P100 per week.
Set goals: emergency fund (3+ months of expenses), retirement, big purchases.
Investing grows your money through compound interest, property, or low-risk funds.
Saving & Investing.summary: Saving and investing early unlock long-term financial security.

Borrowing.title: BORROW: Using Debt Wisely
content: Debt is money you spend that isn’t yours — understand good vs. bad debt.
Good debt helps you build value (education, business, property).
Bad debt involves high-interest, short-term items with no lasting value.
Match loan purpose to duration (short-term vs. long-term loans).
Borrowing.summary: Borrow only when necessary and with a clear repayment plan.

Protecting Assets.title: PROTECT: Financial Security
content: Protect your finances by monitoring accounts and securing personal info.
Avoid scams and identity theft by practicing safe digital habits.
Use insurance to safeguard against emergencies or unexpected losses.
Protecting Assets.summary: Financial protection is just as important as earning and saving.

Improving Literacy.title: ACTIVITY: Improving Financial Literacy Now
content: Create and stick to a monthly budget.
Start or grow your emergency fund.
Make a retirement plan.
Create a strategy to eliminate debt.
Explore ways to earn alternative income.
Improving Literacy.summary: Start with small, practical steps to improve your financial skills today.

The Value of Money.title: Understanding the Value of Money
content: Money is a medium of exchange for goods and services and stores value.
It has evolved from barter systems to digital currency today.
Understanding its value helps in making responsible financial choices.
The Value of Money.summary: The better you understand money, the better you can manage it.

Types of Income.title: Types of Income
content: - **Earned Income**: Salary, wages, commissions.
- **Portfolio Income**: Profits from investments (stocks, real estate).
- **Passive Income**: Royalties, rentals, business ownership with little daily involvement.
Types of Income.summary: Diversifying your income sources can improve financial resilience.

Needs vs Wants.title: Needs vs. Wants
content: Needs are essential for survival: food, housing, healthcare.
Wants enhance life but are not essential: designer clothes, luxury trips.
Identifying them helps control impulsive spending.
Needs vs Wants.summary: Separate needs and wants to build a sustainable financial lifestyle.

Short-Term vs Long-Term Planning.title: Short-Term vs Long-Term Financial Planning
content: Short-term goals: Saving for a phone, clearing monthly bills.
Long-term goals: Buying a house, retirement planning.
Align both in your budget to stay prepared and balanced.
Short-Term vs Long-Term Planning.summary: Financial planning should cover both immediate needs and future dreams.

Avoiding Scams.title: Avoiding Scams and Financial Fraud
content: Be cautious with unsolicited investment offers or job schemes.
Never share PINs or passwords with anyone.
Use official channels and report suspicious activity immediately.
Avoiding Scams.summary: Awareness is your best protection against financial fraud.
